Opet haos zbog finala Kopa Libertadores: Gde sad da se igra?
Ne može bez kontroverzi

05 Nov 2019

Prošle godine u ovo vreme, fudbalska planeta je s pažnjom pratila šta se dešava u Argentini koja je danima bila u kolektivnoj paralizi zbog epskog finala Kopa Libertadores između Boke Juniors i River Plejta. Tada se finale igralo na dve utakmica, prva na Bombonjeri je završena remijem, a revanš na Monumentalu nije odigran zbog haosa na ulicama i napada Riverovih navijača na autobus sa Bokinim igračima. Tek kasnije je revanš odigran u Madridu i River je osvojio titulu.
Godinu dana kasnije, istorija se donekle ponavlja iako nije sve isto. U finalu Kopa Libertadores koje se ove godine igra na jednu utakmicu, trebalo je da se sastanu branilac trofeja River Plejt i verovatno najjači tim Južne Amerike u ovom trenutku, brazilski Flamengo. Finale je bilo zakazano za 23. novembar od 21.30 po našem vremenu i čileanskom Santjagu, ali su sve manje šanse da će tamo i odigrati.
U čileanskoj prestonici su prošlog meseca počele demonstracije zbog poskupljenja gradskog prevoza za četiri odsto (?!). Zapravo, bila je to kap koja je prelila čašu nezadovoljstva naroda i sve je kulminiralo žestokim neredima koji traju nedeljama. Na desetine, često i stotine hiljada ljudi svakog dana demonstrira na ulicama Santijago da Čilea i obračunava se sa državim aparatom. Nekim danima je i preko milion ljudi učestvovalo u protestima koji su prerasli u žestoke i nasilne. Najmanje 23 osobe su od početka protesta izgubile život, ranjeno je više od 1.600, a uhapšeno više od 4.000 ljudi. Gradska železnica je zbog nereda i paljenja pretrpela gubitke od 400.000.000 dolara do sada, državna ekonomija je izgubila 1.600.000.000 dolara od početka nemira. Suočene sa ozbiljnom pretnjom, vlasti su popustile demonstrantima u nekim zahtevima, ali ovi sada traže više i promenu Ustava.



U takvom gradu za dvadesetak dana treba da se odigra finale Kopa Libertadores koje će se sa sobom povući navijačke armije Rivera i najpopularnijeg brazilskog kluba Flamenga koji na titulu čeka skoro 40 godina?!
Deluje neizvodljivo da se meč odigra u Santjagu, ali čileanski ministar sporta apeluje da prestonica njegove zemlje ostane domaćin finala. On garantuje bezbednost i maksimalne uslove svim učesnicima, iako je nacionalno prvenstvo suspendovano na tri nedelje jer nije mogla da se garantuje bezbednost?! A jedna od udarnih pesnica nasilnih demonstranata su upravo tvrda navijačka jezgra najpopularnijih čileanskih klubova Kolo Kola i Univesidad de Čilea.
Predstavnici kontinentalne federacije (KOMNEBOL) još nisu doneli odluku o promeni domaćinstva, ali iz dana u dan je sve izvesnije da će ono Santjagu biti oduzeto.
A šta onda?
Paragvajska prestonica Asunsion se prva ponudila da zameni Santjago i garantuje vrhunsku organizaciju. Na stadionu La Olja (zvanično: General Pablo Rohas) će u subotu veče biti odigrano finale Kopa Sudamerikana, drugog po važnosti kontinentalnog klupskog takmičenja. Rivali će biti ekvadorski Independijente del Valje i argentinski Kolon. Bila bi to idealna proba za domaćinstvo događaja kakav paragvajski fudbal nikad nije doživeo.
Međutim, problem je šta uraditi sa hiljadama navijača koji su već rezervisali karte i smeštaje u Santjagu? Po 12.500 karata su dobili navijači oba kluba, a na hiljade njih će još doći na finale nadajući se nekoj čudesnoj sreći da bi mogli da uđu na stadion. Problema za Asunsion je i što bi se igralo po temperaturi od 40 stepeni ako bi ostao isti termin od 17.00 časova po lokalnom vremenu. A moraće da ostane takav termin zbog prodatih TV prava širom sveta…
Međutim, sve je bolje od rizikovanja hiljada života u zapaljenom Santijagu. Asunsion je najozbiljnija opcija, ali postoje još neke. Pominjala se mogućnost se meč odigra u Majamiju gde živi veliki broj južnoameričke emigracije i koji je ciljno tržište KOMNEBOL-a i velikih južnoameričkih klubova za marketinšku zaradu. Pominje se i kolumbijska Barankilja, ali to je malo verovatna opcija. Na kraju, nije isključeno ni da se zbog vanredne situacije vrati format na dve utakmice i da finale budu odigrano po starom sistemu. Jedan meč na Monumentalu, drugi na Marakani.
U narednim danima će biti poznato da li Santjago zadržava domaćinstvo, a potom i ko će zameniti ako mu oduzmu finale.
(FOTO: Shutterstock)
text:
Again chaos over Copa Libertadores finals: Where to play now?
It cannot do without controversy

05 Nov 2019

Last year at this time, the football planet was closely watching what was going on in Argentina that had been in collective palsy for days over the epic Copa Libertadores final between Boca Juniors and River Plate. Then the finals were played in two games, the first on Bombonjeri was ended with a draw, and the rematch at Monumental was not played due to the chaos on the streets and the attack by Rivera fans on the bus with Bokin players. It was only later that the rematch was played in Madrid and River won the title.
A year later, history is somewhat repeating, though not all the same. In the finals of the Copa Libertadores, which is playing one game this year, they were supposed to meet the defender of the River Plate Trophy and arguably the strongest South American team at the moment, the Brazilian Flamengo. The finale was scheduled for November 23 from 9.30pm CET and Chilean Santiago, but they are less likely to play there.
Demonstrations began in the Chilean capital last month over a four percent (?!) Increase in public transport. In fact, it was a drop that poured over a glass of people's discontent and all culminated in fierce riots that lasted for weeks. Tens, often hundreds of thousands of people are demonstrating on the streets of Santiago da Chile every day and are being dealt with by the state apparatus. Some days, over a million people have participated in protests that have turned violent and violent. At least 23 people have lost their lives since the start of the protests, more than 1,600 were injured and more than 4,000 were arrested. The city's railroad has suffered losses of $ 400,000,000 due to clutter and ignition so far, the state economy losing $ 1,600,000,000 since the start of the unrest. Faced with a serious threat, the authorities have relented to the protesters in some requests, but these are now seeking more and a change in the Constitution.



In such a city, the Copa Libertadores final is to be played in about twenty days, with the fans of the Rivera Army and the most popular Brazilian club Flamenga, which has been waiting for the title for almost 40 years?
It doesn't seem possible for the match to be played in Santiago, but the Chilean sports minister urges his country's capital to host the finals. It guarantees safety and maximum conditions for all participants, although the national championship was suspended for three weeks because security could not be guaranteed ?! And one of the striking fists of violent protesters is the hard core of the most popular Chilean clubs Colo Cola and Univesidad de Chile.
Representatives of the Continental Federation (KOMNEBOL) have not yet made a decision to change the household, but it is becoming more and more certain that Santiago will be taken away day by day.
Then what?
Paraguay's capital Asuncion first offered to replace Santiago and guarantee top-notch organization. The finals of the Copa Sudamerican, the second most important continental club competition, will be played on Saturday night at La Olja Stadium (officially: General Pablo Rohas). The rivals will be the Ecuadorian Independente del Valle and the Argentine Colon. It would be an ideal rehearsal for hosting an event Paraguayan football has never experienced.
However, the problem is what to do with the thousands of fans who have already booked tickets and accommodations in Santiago? The fans of both clubs received 12,500 tickets, and thousands more will reach the finals hoping for some miraculous luck to be able to enter the stadium. The problem for Asuncion is that it would play at 40 degrees if it remained the same time from 5pm local time. And it will have to remain such a term because of TV rights sold worldwide ...
However, everything is better than risking thousands of lives in the inflamed Santiago. Asuncion is the most serious option, but there are some. There was a mention of the possibility of the match being played in Miami, where a large number of South American emigrants live and which is a target market for KOMNEBOL and major South American marketing clubs. The Colombian Barranquilla is also mentioned, but this is an unlikely option. In the end, it is not excluded that due to the emergency situation, the format will return to two games and the finals will be played according to the old system. One match at Monumental, the other at Marakana.
In the coming days, it will be known if Santiago retains the household and then who will replace if they take away the finals.
